title: Analysis and Application of Flipped Learning-Based Mathematics Education Effectiveness

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience with online learning platforms
context.additional_context: Course verifying the effectiveness of flipped learning in a blended environment combining face-to-face classes and online pre-learning. Learners engage in discussions and problem-solving activities in face-to-face sessions after completing pre-recorded video lectures and quizzes

learning_goals: In the flipped learning model, over 80% of learners fully master pre-learning materials and participate in face-to-face classes.
The flipped learning group achieves at least a 15% improvement in math knowledge assessment scores compared to traditional classes.
Over 75% of learners report positive perceptions (autonomy, engagement, comprehension) of the flipped learning approach in surveys.

resources: Face-to-face classroom space and instructional materials

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
